modules.description: Transforms a parsed document AST into valid HTML files with proper structure and styling. Provides functions to generate a numbered table of contents, convert the AST to HTML, and prepare the full HTML body with title and style. Directly used to write the final HTML output of a TeX file to disk.

This module processes glossary files into HTML, providing functions to parse entries, check file existence, and combine glossary data into a structured format. It works with strings and hash tables to store and manipulate glossary terms and definitions. Concrete use cases include converting textbook glossary files into HTML output and extracting term-definition pairs from formatted input.

This module parses LaTeX documents into an abstract syntax tree (AST) composed of commands and structures such as chapters, sections, environments, and math expressions. It processes raw strings by identifying LaTeX commands (e.g., `\chapter`, `\fracx`), extracting arguments, and organizing content into nested structures like `Env`, `OneArgCmd`, and `Subsubsection`. Concrete use cases include transforming LaTeX source into structured data for HTML rendering or analyzing document layout for automated conversion.

This module generates LaTeX code from parsed mathematical structures, primarily handling commands, environments, and their parameters. It transforms structured data like expressions and environments (e.g., align, equation) into valid LaTeX strings suitable for web rendering. Use cases include converting internal AST representations of math content into displayable LaTeX for HTML output and recalculating environment indices to ensure correct numbering and alignment in rendered equations.

This module provides functions for string and file manipulation, including checking if a string starts with a prefix, converting a string to a list of characters, reading a file into a list of lines, and writing a string to a file. It works with basic data types such as strings, character lists, and file paths. Concrete use cases include parsing text files, processing string data, and handling file input/output operations.

This module combines glossary processing, HTML generation, math rendering, document parsing, and utility functions to convert LaTeX textbooks into structured HTML. It handles LaTeX abstract syntax trees, glossary entries, and mathematical expressions, transforming them into HTML and LaTeX output. Concrete use cases include converting textbook sources into web-ready HTML with cross-referenced equations and structured glossaries.
